intro: Mentha arvensis var. glabrata, commonly known as narrow-leafed mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pale blue or purple flowers in whorls along the stem, typically blooming from June to August. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed areas. Mentha arvensis var. glabrata is valued for its aromatic leaves and has been used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb.
